phrasetype.name: Message

phrase.name: error_admin_reason_filetoolarge
phrase.regularexpression: The uploaded file was too large\.

phrasetype.phrase: The uploaded file was too large.

phrase.name: error_reason_fileextensionnotdefined
phrase.regularexpression: File extension ([\w]+) not defined in the file types manager, and only defined file types may be added\.

phrasetype.phrase: File extension $1 not defined in the file types manager, and only defined file types may be added.

phrase.name: error_reason_filetypenotdefined
phrase.regularexpression: File extension ([\w.]+) is not defined in the file types manager, and only defined file types may be added.

phrasetype.phrase: File extension $1 is not defined in the file types manager, and only defined file types may be added.

phrase.name: error_reason_imagefunction
phrase.regularexpression: Function image([\w]+) does not exist\. Please verify the specified Image Type is correct and the proper libraries are installed\.

phrasetype.phrase: Function image$1 does not exist. Please verify the specified Image Type is correct and the proper libraries are installed.

phrase.name: error_reason_largefile
phrase.regularexpression: The uploaded file was too large\.

phrasetype.phrase: The uploaded file was too large.

phrase.name: verifyimagetypelibraries
phrase.regularexpression: Please verify the specified Image Type is correct and the proper libraries are installed\.

phrasetype.phrase: Please verify the specified Image Type is correct and the proper libraries are installed.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: If defined, digital content identifiers consisting only of numerals will be padded with zeros to ensure the numbers appear with at least the minimum number of characters.
Sets the maximum number of Digital Content objects to display their images in the thumbnail section of the Digital Library's public interface.
Determines the maximum file size in KB for the long preview generated by the digital library.
Determines the maximum file size in KB for the short preview generated by the digital library.
Determines the image width for the medium thumbnail generated by the digital library.
Determines the image width for the small thumbnail generated by the digital library.

phrasetype.name: Public Phrase
phrasetype.phrase: Show Digital Content Titles Beginning with

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase:
Use this field to record the MIME content type that should be sent to the user's browser when a user attempts to download this type of file For example, record the content type as 'audio/mpeg' for mp3 files.
The content type is used by the file associations listed in the user's web browser to display or load the digital content using the user's preferred applications.
A list of registered content types is available at http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/.
Use this field to list the file type extensions represented by the "File Type" field. The extensions must be seperated by a comma.
Use this field to describe of the types of file represented by the file extensions listed in the "File Extensions" field.
Use the File Types Manager to define the types of digital content that administrative users will be allowed to upload into Archon.

Use this drop-down list to select the general category which best describes files of this type.
The value selected here is used by Archon to determine which graphics will be displayed in the public interface as links to digital objects of this type. For example, links to photos will display differently than links to digital audio.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Changing this radio button to 'no' will suppress the public view digital object and its associated description.

This field lists the name of the collection content with which the digital content you are uploading will be linked. Depending on the degree to which the collection is described in the 'Collection Content Manager,' it may be possible to nest the link in a specific series, folder, or item-level descriptive record.

This field lists the name of the collection with which the digital content you are uploading will be linked.Â Depending on the degree to which the collection is described in the 'Collection Content Manager,' it may be possible to nest the link in a specific series, folder, or item-level descriptive record in the following field.
Use this field to provide a link to digital content stored outside of the Archon system. The link should be an absolute URL.
Open this section to link a creator authority record or records to the digital object.
Use this field to record the creation date (at any level of specificity available) for the digital object.

Select 'full' if you want users to download the source file, 'preview only' if you wish to allow access to preview files, and 'none' if you wish to show metadata only. Warning: Changing this value will set the access level for all currently related files.
Open this section to provide additional description about the digital resource.
Use this field to record the name of the individual or corporate body which donated or contributed the item. This field maps to the Dublin Core contributor element.

Use this field to record a description of the physical characteristics FOR THE ANALOG SOURCE of a digital object. Use this field ONLY if the digital object was not 'born digital,' but was digitized from an analog source, such as a photographic print or a cassette tape.
Use this field to record the name of the publisher of the digital library content. This field maps to the Dublin Core publisher element.
Use this field to record a statement regarding the copyright status, or other rights associated with the digital object.
Use this field to record a scope/content note, i.e. a detailed description of the digital object. This field is used to record additional information that cannot be recorded in the 'title' field.

Open this section to upload a digital object directly into the Archon system, rather than linking to an external resource. Clicking the "Add New/Update Files" button will upload a new file and/or update information about previously uploaded files.
Select 'full' if you want users to download the source file, 'preview only' if you wish to allow access to preview files, and 'none' if you wish to show metadata only.

Use this field to specify the order in which the individual files should appear to the user, when a digital object consists of multiple files, i.e. when it is a 'compound object' such as a multi-page document or an extended audio file with multiple tracks.

Choose an unrelated file from the select box that will be related to this digital content. If you would like to upload a new file, click "Upload File" to launch the upload dialog. Within the dialog, click the browse button to look for the file on your local system.
This field displays the format and medium of the stored file.

When more than one file is being uploaded (e.g. for multi-page documents), this field may be used to record a title or caption for each one of the individual files being added. Use of the field is optional.

The Digital Library Manager is used to link to external digital objects or to upload digital objects directly into Archon.
Use this interface to add new pieces of digital content to the collection. If the Collections package is installed and enabled, you can associate the individual pieces with content defined under the Collections Manager.
Use this field to record a local identifier assigned by the repository to the digital content. This field maps to the Dublin Core identifier element.
Open this section if you wish to specify the language or languages used in the digital objects.
Use this field to select a creator record to associate as the primary creator for this digital content.
Open this section if you wish to associate subject authority records with the digital library content.
Use this field to record the main title/caption of the piece of digital object being uploaded into Archon.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: This field indicates whether or not the files are cached to disk.
This field displays the file paths where the cached files are stored on disk.
Select 'full' if you want users to download the source file, 'preview only' if you wish to allow access to preview files, and 'none' if you wish to show metadata only.
Use this field to link the file to a digital content record.

Use this field to specify the order in which the individual files should appear to the user, when a digital object consists of multiple files, i.e. when it is a 'compound object' such as a multi-page document or an extended audio file with multiple tracks.
This field displays the name of the file that was originally uploaded.
This field describes the type of the file that is uploaded.

When more than one file is being uploaded (e.g. for multi-page documents), this field may be used to record a title or caption for each one of the individual files being added. Use of the field is optional.
Use the File Manager to edit or delete files and their metadata.
